article: Butch O'Hare was a fighter pilot. One day his entire squadron was sent on a mission. In the air after taking off, he realized that someone had  _  to fill up the tank. He would not have enough  _  to complete his flight and get back to his ship. His flight  _  told him to return to the carrier . As he was returning to the mother  _  , he saw something that turned his blood  _  . A squadron of Japanese planes was speeding their way toward the  _  fleet .The fleet was defenseless. He couldn't  _  his squadron and brings them back in time to save the fleet. Nor could he  _  the fleet of the coming danger. There was only one thing to do. He  _  force the Japanese away from the fleet. Laying aside all the thoughts of personal  _  , he dove his plane into the formation of Japanese  _  . Bravely he continued the fighting. He dove at the planes,  _  to hit the enemy planes in hopes of  _  as many enemy planes as possible.  _  , the angry Japanese squadron flew away in another  _  . With a great weight taken off his  _  Butch O'Hare and his damaged fighter came back to the carrier. The film from the camera on his plane told the  _  . It showed Butch's daring action to  _  his fleet. He had in fact destroyed five enemy aircraft. He became an American hero.
